post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, December 15
post.Content:
10 days until Christmas - that's crazy - where has the time gone?! Seriously! I don't even know if I'll get the Christmas tree up in time this year!

JavaFX

  • Johan Vos has posted part one of a series of YouTube videos detailing JavaFX Android support.
  • Speaking of Android, ?ukasz ?liwi?ski has  posted about creating an Android 5 ripple effect in JavaFX. It looks pretty neat.
  • Gerrit Grunwald has done another Friday Fun Component, this time a simple clock (for use on an e-ink screen). Again, it looks neat - nice and simple :-)
  • Rob Terpilowski has open sourced StockChartsFX - a candle stick chart for JavaFX.
  • Matthieu Brouillard has announced that CSSFX has been merged into Scenic View master branch.
  • Dirk Lemmermann has released version 1.2.0 of his (commercial) FlexGanttFX library. There are a huge number of bug fixes and improvements in this release.

Griffon

  • Griffon 2.1.0 has been released, with a bunch of improvements and some binary incompatibilities - so read the announcement! :-)

Catch you all next week! :-)
